title._content: ["Hampton," John Ridgely house, Hampton Lane, Towson, Md. (LOC)

description._content: Johnston, Frances Benjamin,, 1864-1952,, photographer. ["Hampton," John Ridgely house, Hampton Lane, Towson, Md. North façade, entrance] [ca. 1915] 1 photograph : glass lantern slide, hand-colored ; 3.25 x 4 in. Notes: Site History. House Architecture: Captain Charles Ridgley and Jehu Hall, architect and master carpenter, from 1783. Landscape: Boxwood parterres designed originally by Charles Carnon Ridgely 1795-1810. Today: The Hampton National Historic Site On slide (handwritten): "R" and "Ridgely John - Hampton, Md." Photographed when Frances Benjamin Johnston and Mattie Edwards Hewitt worked together. Title, date, and subject information provided by Sam Watters, 2011. Forms part of: Garden and historic house lecture series in the Frances Benjamin Johnston Collection (Library of Congress). Rights Info: No known restrictions on publication. Repository: Library of Congress, Prints and Photographs Division, Washington, D.C. 20540 USA, hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/pp.print Higher resolution image is available (Persistent URL): hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/ppmsca.16579 Call Number: LC-J717-X106- 9
